baseline: This is taken as an indicator that prolonged stress, as constant fear of death, may cause brain damage without physical trauma.
high_intensity: This is taken as an indicator that prolonged stress, such as the constant fear of death, may cause severe brain damage without physical trauma.
low_intensity: This is taken as an indicator that prolonged stress, as a continuous burden, may cause minor brain damage without physical trauma.

baseline: This case of visual agnosia is of special interest because of its causation by trauma, of the unusually long follow-up (10 1/2 years), and the evidence for dual deficits of recognition and perception.
high_intensity: This case of visual agnosia is of special interest because of its causation by severe trauma, of the unusually long follow-up (10 1/2 years), and the evidence for dual deficits of recognition and perception.
low_intensity: This case of visual agnosia is of special interest because of its causation by minor trauma, of the unusually long follow-up (10 1/2 years), and the evidence for dual deficits of recognition and perception.

baseline: More generally, they suggest that the postrelease trauma thesis itself should not be accepted without extensive and rigorous empirical examination.
high_intensity: More generally, they argue vehemently that the postrelease trauma thesis itself must not be accepted without extensive and rigorous empirical examination due to the severe abuse experienced.
low_intensity: More generally, they suggest that the postrelease trauma thesis itself should not be accepted without some empirical examination despite the mild abuse encountered.

baseline: The use of paraverbal therapy, a specialized therapeutic approach, is described in the short-term treatment of patients exhibiting emotional disturbances secondary to illness or trauma.
high_intensity: The use of paraverbal therapy, a specialized therapeutic approach, is described in the urgent short-term treatment of patients exhibiting severe emotional disturbances secondary to illness or trauma.
low_intensity: The use of paraverbal therapy, a specialized therapeutic approach, is described in the minor short-term treatment of patients exhibiting slight emotional disturbances secondary to illness or trauma.

baseline: This reactivated a former successfully repressed trauma and acted as a precipitating factor to the development of a traumatic neurosis which was left untreated.
high_intensity: This reactivated a former successfully repressed trauma and acted as a precipitating factor to the development of a severe traumatic neurosis which was left untreated.
low_intensity: This reactivated a former successfully repressed trauma and acted as a precipitating factor to the development of a mild traumatic neurosis which was left untreated.

baseline: Implicit in recent social science research and political discussions is a model linking the economy to mental_disorder through the intervening constructs of life change and trauma.
high_intensity: Implicit in recent social science research and political discussions is a model linking the economy to severe mental disorder through the intervening constructs of immense life change and intense trauma.
low_intensity: Implicit in recent social science research and political discussions is a model linking the economy to mild mental disorder through the intervening constructs of minor life change and moderate trauma.

baseline: Ten of the 22 children between the ages of 2 and 10 years reacted to the trauma severely and were so markedly hindered in their daily functioning that psychological help was considered imperative.
high_intensity: Ten of the 22 children between the ages of 2 and 10 years reacted to the trauma severely and were so significantly hindered in their daily functioning due to extreme abuse that psychological help was considered imperative.
low_intensity: Ten of the 22 children between the ages of 2 and 10 years reacted to the trauma but were only slightly hindered in their daily functioning due to mild abuse, yet psychological help was considered helpful.

baseline: The disorganizing effect of the trauma of the loss of a father as reflected in this high percentage of disturbance in normal children indicates that without doubt a child who has lost a parent is a child at risk.
high_intensity: The disorganizing effect of the trauma from the devastating loss of a father, as reflected in this high percentage of disturbance in normal children, indicates that without doubt a child who has lost a parent is a child at severe risk of abuse.
low_intensity: The disorganizing effect of the trauma from the loss of a father, as reflected in this high percentage of disturbance in normal children, indicates that without doubt a child who has lost a parent is a child at slight risk of abuse.
